content:
hi.

im huuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuunnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnngggggggggggggrrrrrrrrrrrrrrryyyyyyyyyyy.

my stomach is crying out for food.

i will go and quiet it down a bit.

this is my one hundred and eleventh day of being a member of xanga. at least, on this account.

i really should update more (like certain people insist) but why bother?

so…

spring break…

or as ccs calls it, easter vacation…

did you know people have taken to calling the easter bunny “the spring bunny”? thats just sad. they have to take god outta everything. and easter wasnt even originally christian! it was PAGAN!

okay, had my little rant for the day…

anyways, spring break has its ups…

and its downs…

the downs (being their annoying selves) came first.

day 1/2 (friday): goes to tahoe with ichthus. comes down with a raging fever and insatiable thirst. pigs out on candy, then gets more sick.

day 1: plays soccer in the snow. makes cards for guys appreciation. comes down with blistering cold. goes to the cabin early and sleeps while everyone else, oblivious to any of this, screams at the tops of their voices. no, not at the cabin, at the OTHER cabin. watches princess bride with michaela twince in a row (hey, its a good movie! well except for that short guy going, “inconceivable! INCONCEIVABLE!” inconceivable, my butt)

day 2: allergy attack. arrives home a mess (and a dirty mess, to boot). goes to sleep vvvvveeeeeeeerrrrrrryyyyy late.

day 3: virtuously sets about to try to complete homework. fails. does nothing for the rest of the day.

and now…

im doing NOTHING.

well, okay, im typing and im sitting and im breathing AND blinking at the same time (amazing, isnt it) and other crap but nothing really.

so…

i will go do something more productive with my time.

i think ill take a nap.

we made tshirts at jojos house today!!! they look freakishly awesome.

“wow, your tshirt looks… so..so real.” i quote directly from my friends.

rias shirts gonna be the same as mines except that hers is gonna say “mojo” steada “goober” and “38” steada “22”.

haivin so much fun!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

d=(^.^)z

haha me and my sister (there goes the grammar) went to the dentist today. my teeth were almost perfect, just a little gingivitis or however you spell it. no braces for me!!! ^.^ my sister wasnt so lucky. she has another cavity AND her bite is weird AND her teeth are too big so now she has to go to a orthodontist. poor girl. i feel for her. i think.

well…

i just found out what a stupid unintelligent fool i am.

i have gotten Ds and Fs on ALL the quizzes on a tale of two cities.

Ds and Fs.

thank god my parents dont check powerschool, or i might be decapitated *shudders* with a kitchen cleaver or something. dont know about you, but i would prefer something somewhat on the extremely sharp side if i wanted to be decapitated.

i was remarking to a friend today that my parental units must have somehow malfunctioned while attempting to program the right time to pick their children up. school ends at 3.40. it does not end at 4.30. however, i was sadly mistaken. they actually do know the correct time (SHOCK). my parental units had been delayed by a somewhat dense client of theirs who simply did not understand the simple words I NEED TO GO PICK MY CHILDREN UP. how dense can you get? i mean, my father stood up and made motions to leave, but no, no, she just had to stay a little longer and explain her whole life story. i simply do not understand these people. do they not understand that people actually do other things besides listen to them talk about themselves? really. some people need to grow up *coughs to self*.

i was proofreading another friend’s essay last week when i discovered why aim is bad for you. this poor girl has simply had more aim than is healthy. “u”s and “b4”s were lttered throughout her essay, as well as the occasional “um… ”. i do not mean to insult her. but look at what im (and every other internet service) is doing. it has utterly destroyed what little vocabulary the highschoolers of today currently possess. well, excepting a few nerds here and there. *sighs* i’m fighting a losing battle here. best give up while i’m still behind.

yay!!! i can FINALLY post on my xanga using my asininely SLOW computer!!! wait, is asininely a word? o.O i havent been thinking straight for about a week and a half now, i think its a new record.

i also wrote a very interesting essay…

Chills ran down my spine as I looked out my bedroom window one bright, sunny morning. No, I did not shudder at any of the usual yappy little dogs or the ghastly overweight specters that are commonly called raccoons. Fortunately, neither of these horrible creatures was currently skulking around my neighborhood. But I digress from my tale of woe. I will continue. I did not shudder at the disgusting waste from the construction site on our hill. Nor did I shudder at the disgusting waste that the deer made while consuming what cannot currently be called a garden. No, I shuddered at the sun. That bright, shiny, fiery red ball in the sky that supposedly bestows heat and light upon us poor needy humans. I could appreciate the light. There was plenty of light (maybe a little too much). What I could not appreciate was the heat, because there was simply no heat at all. The sun was only doing one of its jobs! I glared at the sun. It was definitely mocking me. Its very presence betrayed the glee it must have felt at torturing poor, innocent people by giving light without heat. Sure, one or two days of sharp, icy mornings, boiling hot afternoons, and deathly chilly nights is fine with me. I mean, we humans can survive with feverish heads and bodies that feel dead for a while. Our bodies can take the ever-so-constant temperatures. Well, at least for some reasonable amount of time. But for us to live like this for five straight days? I think not. After all, one’s body can only take so much torture. One’s body can only freeze so much while it is still trying to boil itself. One’s body can only suffer one malady at a time (i.e. I cannot have heatstroke and frostbite at the same time). I do not think the elements of nature quite understand that I can only take so much anguish before I die of what shall henceforth be known to all as “frost-stroke.” Do not confuse the meaning of my words. I do not mean to actually blame the weather. After all, it is only human, right?

Many students at Chinese Christian Schools may not have noticed that I wear a skort to school. Skorts are the best things that ever happened to school uniform. Not only are they comfortable, but they also are easy and light to run in when one has conveniently forgotten one’s gym clothes (as opposed to those skirts that do not have handy little shorts underneath for when you’re running in windy conditions or those pants with abnormal cuts that never quite fit the legs of your average teenage girl). However, I have one little issue with those fantastic bottoms. Skorts do not keep your legs from freezing over on one of those glorious, cold, and very windy days. They do not shield your poor, innocent limbs from the ever harsh rain, nor do they prevent a good game of “hey-let’s-splash-mud-on-the-sophomore.” So when I finally convinced myself to get out of bed that fateful morn, what was the first thing I did? I pulled on my handy dandy skort! Thanks to my dear sibling, I no longer have a pair of presentable uniform khaki pants (unless you count the one that I fit three years ago). So on goes the skort. On I go to another day of temperature extremities.

As soon as I returned to the torture teachers lovingly refer to as school for another six hours of trying to focus on my studies, I realized that I had forgotten one thing. This particular object of which I speak was vital to my existence. Dare you laugh? I had conveniently left my pencil somewhere that was so safe that even I could not locate it. I scrounged around in my backpack, hoping to recover some long-forgotten stick of wood that I could use to finish the last geometric proof for my homework assignment. I finally discovered that I had left the pencil in my pocket (I had been wondering what had been poking me ever so persistently). I thank God for small wonders in life such as that. I furiously scribbled illegible marks on my homework paper, trying to figure out why sixty is not divisible by eleven. Thankfully, I was relieved of such ponderings by a classmate of mine who kindly pointed out that I had multiplied six and ten instead of six and four, and that I need not divide by eleven in the first place. “Gee” was the word that I so eloquently used to express my frustration at my brain’s sudden idiocy. “I’m so smart that I’m stupid.” I angrily packed up my books and headed out the door. The emotions I felt were so strong that I could not even speak coherently until fifteen minutes had passed. And as I walked out the door, I heard my helpful classmate cheerfully say, “At least the sun’s still shining.”

i sound so strange. in fact, i had to change some of the words for fear of being mocked.

well, i probably will be mocked anyway.

well thats normal for me…

ill just hope that the teacher wont read it out loud in class again. that would embarress me to no end.

wow, thats the longest post ive ever written.

im sorry for those of you who dont like to read long posts, i know how it feels to scroll down like fifty pages of teeny tiny font that goes on forever. i especially hate it when people attempt to sound idiotic (and failing even there) by using abnormal speech (such examples can be found right here.

farewell strange strangers.

you know what? well, you probably dont, but anyways…

all i ever write on either of my xangas is DEPRESSING BORING SLIGHTLY INSANE information that no one needs to know.

*sighs*

“i am currently decapitating myself and/or cutting off my ears. please leave me to my self-mutilation. thank you.”

i mean, what the heck was i thinking?

aah, what the freak, ima be too lazy to change it…

:) what a wonderful world.

content:
its so… so misspelled.

i thought, “geez, i cant remember the stupid usernames i make up, im just going to make a new xanga with my real name and be done with it.”

sounds easy?

well, maybe for you.

so anyways, when i was filling in those thingies (the name escapes me) for getting a xanga, i thought, “well now, theres bound to be hundreds of gabrielles in this world… i think ill spell it funny just for the heck of it. like i accidentally did on my homework.”

gabbriell?

so… at least i can vaguely remember what my xanga is currently called.

whenever anyone asks for the name of my xanga, i can safely say that it goes along the lines of “gabrielle”.

“gabriell”?

or “gabbrielle”?

or maybe “goober”… “gai bei”?

hopefully, i will remember to use somewhat proper grammar and spelling. sorry, for those people who care, i will not be using apostrophes or proper capitalization. im just too lazy. most people will probably agree with me that it is easier not to press the shift key or the apostrophe key so often. my internet grammar and spelling havent spilled into my essays yet, so i think im pretty safe.

i think i digressed far too many times. yay, i used a somewhat big word out of my extensive, spelling bee winner, but currently dead vocabulary!

wait… does that make sense? o.O

joy. sheer bliss.

content:
“you disgust me, all of you, you and your happiness! and your life, that has to be loved at any price. you’re like dogs fawning on everyone they come across. with just a little hope left every day - if you don’t expect too much. but i want everything, now! and to the full! or else i decline the offer, lock, stock, and barrel! i don’t want to be sensible, and satisfied with a scrap - if i behave myself! i want to be sure of having everything, now, this very day, and it had to be as wonderful as it was when i was little. otherwise i prefer to die.” -quoted from antigone by jean anouilh

lovely huh?

though this person had some guts to stand up to someone who could destroy her and everyone she loved.

well thank you for reading this little episode of my so-called life, so sorry for boring you. i will be taking my leave.

content: well, i’ve been back for a week from my trip and it wasn’t too kablooey (except there were too many rocks - first grand canyon then monument valley then valley of the gods then bryce canyon and many more that i did not pay much attention to!!!) but now the aged p.s are mad at me for reasons that i simply cannot comprehend at this time. oh, and i found out i have attention deficit disorder (otherwise known to normal ppl as add). not much of a surprise as my teachers have been darkly hinting at this for the past four years, but my parents are seriously thinking of drugging me. eew, my sister just found mold in the fridge. but i digress. let us continue my tirade of idiotic ideas. i’m surprised people would actually read this nonsense. well, i guess miracles happen. not that this is really a miracle… i’m digressing AGAIN. in case you haven’t figured it out, digressing is straying off the subject of a story, paragraph, lecture, or conversation. oh yeah, and on top of that, i have a karate exam today - going for the second highest belt (kinda between brown and black) hmm… the creation of kushanku… kushanku is a kata (or set) created by a chinese military officer in 1762. he taught these techniques to okinawans who brought kushanku back to okinawa (a japanese island). kushanku was originally named koshokun, but due to the okinawan language (which has only three vowels - a, i, and u), it became known as kushanku. i think naha-te, tomari-te, and shuri-te are styles of karatedo. i believe naha-te was body-building, shuri-te wasn for small people with quick movements, something related to shaolin kungfu, and tomari-te blended both syles. there, that should cover my test.  my stupid teacher went to a board meeting of the wadokai karatedo federation and all they came out saying was that they agreed karate was different frm karatedo. i mean, really. how weird can they get? well better go now…
